meanings.definition: To make preparations for a journey or trip.
meanings.sent1: I need to pretravel before our vacation to pack my suitcase.
meanings.sent2: It is important to pretravel by checking the weather at our destination.
meanings.sent3: Sarah always pretravels meticulously, even for short weekend getaways.
meanings.sent4: His mind started to pretravel to all the exciting adventures that awaited him.
meanings.sent5: Pretraveling efficiently can save you from last-minute stress.

meanings.sent1: The pretravel checklist helped us ensure we didn't forget anything.
meanings.sent2: The pretravel excitement made it hard to focus on anything else.
meanings.sent3: The pretravel jitters kept her up all night before the big trip.
meanings.sent4: The pretravel rush at the airport was chaotic but thrilling.
meanings.sent5: The pretravel anticipation was almost as exciting as the trip itself.

meanings.definition: The act of planning or arranging for a trip.
meanings.sent1: Proper pretravel is essential for a smooth journey.
meanings.sent2: She always takes care of pretravel details like booking accommodations.
meanings.sent3: The pretravel for their anniversary getaway was a delightful experience.
meanings.sent4: The pretravel for the company retreat involved coordinating schedules and transportation.
meanings.sent5: Effective pretravel can make your trip more enjoyable and stress-free.
